## Notes

-  wanted to do this more than once and had no idea these existed... 
-  > Find the "previous" (lag()) or "next" (lead()) values in a vector. Useful for comparing values behind of or ahead of the current values. 




## Example

```{r}
judges100 |> 
  filter(!is.na(birth_date)) |> # just in case 
  select(birth_date) |> 
  head(10) |> 
  mutate(birth_lag = lag(birth_date), birth_lead=lead(birth_date)) 
 

```
